flow.descriptionCdata:
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.36700e4c-cf4d-4995-853c-6476cd5cd11d.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.5ff53161-99e2-4061-9454-642ee415f578.description=Iterates through a list of values.If the list changes while running, the updates will be appended to the list. Inputs\: list - The list to iterate through. separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list. Returns\: The current element of the list, if the response is has more Responses\: has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned. has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list. failure - failed to process the list. Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously. WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.. da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.7dd97928-724c-436c-a636-006510b8406f.description=
Executes an Expression (e.x value1 \=\= value2)

Input Parameters\:
value1 - the value to threshold with
value2 - the threshold to threshold against
operator - (\=\=, \!\=,  >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
okstring - string to push into returnResult if the threshold has not been passed
failedstring - string to push into the returnResult if the threshold has been passed

Responses\:
true - the expression is true
fales - the expression is false
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.916a0483-7c16-4b16-8c95-5c483ced7933.description= 
Checks to see if a path points to a directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - the path to check
username - username to use when reading.
password - password to use when reading.

Responses\:
failure			- the operation failed. The path does not point to a directory.
success			- The operation succeeded.
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.9c86c5d1-6076-4caf-998e-822bb24a6b0b.description=
Gets a list of files and folders in a directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - The directory to check.
delimiter - A delimiter to put between files and folders in the directory.
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.

Returns\:
The children of the path.

Extra Results\:
count - The number of children.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The path probably could not be found, or was a file.
success - The operation succeeded.
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.ba07c5f1-fb8b-42da-95fb-2cbb457df169.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.d3aeb88e-3dcf-428f-92e5-153b95cd4307.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.description=
Goes through a Windows directory and returns the name of the largest file.

Inputs\:
Source - The source directory.
user - The username to run as.
password - Password for user.
recursive - Whether to recurse through sub-directories.

Responses\:
success - Operation completed.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
The name of the largest file.

Extra Results\:
size - The size of the largest file.
da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.e78ac49f-227b-48fc-8250-95270eecc87c.prompt=Should the operation check subfolders? WARNING this may be very slow da8ba8bc-f6c4-4ff6-88c2-4cbc804701dd.f422036a-624e-4fbe-bb40-844637fda658.description=
Compares a files size to a given threshold.

Input Parameters\:
source - The file to read
threshold - The threshold to compare the file size to (in bytes).
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The file probably could not be found.
greater than	- The file's size is larger than the threshold.
less than - The file's size is smaller than the threshold.
equal to - The file's size is the same as the threshold.

Extra Results\:
size - The file's size in bytes.
flow.name: Get Largest File (1)
